intro: Heliophila glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in shallow water or damp soil, making it a common sight in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are arranged in spikes, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Heliophila glabrescens is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support aquatic ecosystems.
